page.title: 03THE BATTLE OF MALDON
page.content: This took place in 991.The Danes often sailed to England and stole val- uables and burned towns.Ethelred the King made a deal with the Danes.If they stopped,he would pay them a large sum of money.Ethelred had to ask peo- ple to contribute money for their own protection.The Earl of Essex,Brithnoth refused to let his people pay up.Soon the Danes began the attacks again.They sailed up the River Blackwater to Nor- they Island while Brithnoth and his army waited for them on the mainland. The Danes began to cross the causeway which was so narrow that they were hacked to pieces as they came across one by one.The Danes asked if they could come ashore and fight fairly. Foolishly Brithnoth agreed and the battle began.Brithnoth and many men were killed.The Danes marched in tri- umph to Danbury Hill and made camp.
